metadata.name: Deployment Scripts
metadata.description: This module deploys a Deployment Script.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. Display name of the script to be run.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Type of the script. AzurePowerShell, AzureCLI.
Optional. Azure PowerShell module version to be used.
Optional. Azure CLI module version to be used.
Optional. Script body. Max length: 32000 characters. To run an external script, use primaryScriptURI instead.
Optional. Uri for the external script. This is the entry point for the external script. To run an internal script, use the scriptContent instead.

Optional. The environment variables to pass over to the script. The list is passed as an object with a key name "secureList" and the value is the list of environment variables (array). The list must have a 'name' and a 'value' or a 'secretValue' property for each object.
Optional. List of supporting files for the external script (defined in primaryScriptUri). Does not work with internal scripts (code defined in scriptContent).
Optional. Command-line arguments to pass to the script. Arguments are separated by spaces.

Optional. Interval for which the service retains the script resource after it reaches a terminal state. Resource will be deleted when this duration expires. Duration is based on ISO 8601 pattern (for example P7D means one week).
Optional. When set to false, script will run every time the template is deployed. When set to true, the script will only run once.

Optional. The clean up preference when the script execution gets in a terminal state. Specify the preference on when to delete the deployment script resources. The default value is Always, which means the deployment script resources are deleted despite the terminal state (Succeeded, Failed, canceled).

Optional. Container group name, if not specified then the name will get auto-generated. Not specifying a 'containerGroupName' indicates the system to generate a unique name which might end up flagging an Azure Policy as non-compliant. Use 'containerGroupName' when you have an Azure Policy that expects a specific naming convention or when you want to fully control the name. 'containerGroupName' property must be between 1 and 63 characters long, must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and dashes and it cannot start or end with a dash and consecutive dashes are not allowed.
Optional. The resource ID of the storage account to use for this deployment script. If none is provided, the deployment script uses a temporary, managed storage account.
Optional. Maximum allowed script execution time specified in ISO 8601 format. Default value is PT1H - 1 hour; 'PT30M' - 30 minutes; 'P5D' - 5 days; 'P1Y' 1 year.
Generated. Do not provide a value! This date value is used to make sure the script run every time the template is deployed.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
